Events that occurred on 1 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien is working on The Grey Bridge of Tavrobel while in Brooklands Officers' Hospital, Kingston upon Hull.
1938 - J.R.R. Tolkien goes on holiday to recuperate (see Letter 33).
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49b.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien met Clyde S. Kilby.
1971 - Actor Dave Wittenberg is born.
1977 - Cliffs Notes on Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit is published.
1989 - Oliphaunt is published.
2009 - The Lord of the Films is published.
2011 - A Tolkien Tapestry is published.
2011 - A Critical Companion to J.R.R. Tolkien: A Literary Reference to His Life and Works is published.
2011 - J.R.R. Tolkien, a children's book from Holiday House, was published.
2016 - Songs of Sorrow and Hope: The Art of Jenny Dolfen is published.
2016 - Tolkien Calendar 2017 is published.
2020 - Tolkien Calendar 2021 is published.
2022 - The first two episodes of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power are released online.
2022 - A new and revised edition of The Complete Guide to Middle-earth by Robert Foster is released.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
